bug.short_desc: qx.ui.form.SelectBox hides when blurred even if the new focus is a ListItem

long_desc.thetext:
I subclassed ListItem in a way that makes it focusable, but focusing the ListItem inside the List/Popup blurs the SelectBox it is in, and in turns hides the List/Popup, which is not the desired behaviour.
I suggest that the event handler for "blur" on a SelectBox should only hide the popup if the newly focused item isn't a descendant of the popup. It would then be the responsibility of the descendant to hide the popup when it gets blurred in turn.

The suggested solution may not be sufficiently generic to get built into the framework. Have you also tried to derive from SelectBox (or configure a menu button) to address the behavior of all widgets involved?
Martin, please see how this issue could either be resolved in the framework or with some suggestions for user code (maybe worth a snippet or demo later?).
Sorry for taking my time to check this. Just upgraded to trunk and tested Martin's solution, and it works perfectly. Thanks.
